website_summaries.verdict: Fast-acting powder that will kill fleas and ticks quickly, and it's easy to use.
pros: Works fast, so you can apply it and then vacuum it up again shortly afterward
Has a low price point and delivers up to 400-square-feet of coverage
Works on adult fleas, eggs, and larvae, while also killing ticks
Product is safer to use around people and pets than some others
cons: May not work as well with a heavy infestation as it does if you catch them early

customer_reviews.title: Great for fleas, horrible smell
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works but gives off a horrible chemical sMell worse than bug bombs I've tried. I used it in our upstairs bedroom as that's the only place with carpet and it made the whole house smell of strong chemicals. I checked the bottle to make sure it was ok to stay in the house or if I needed to open windows and it didn't say anything about that. It just said avoid contact with skin, getting wet, and getting into the air. I hope it's ok to breath in after vacuuming.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: If you close your eyes, it's like the fleas didappear.
customer_reviews.text: It's... Okay. I especially like all the fleas jumping on me when this is worked into the carpet, and how they immediately come back after vacuuming. It seems less bad than it was, but only just. Always a safe bet that if the name includes any allusion to being environmentally friendly, it will barely work. So good job maintaining that constant.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Mesmer

customer_reviews.title: I like Simple Solutions flea and tick spray better!
customer_reviews.text: It's not natural like they make it sound. If you want natural, get Simple Solutions flea and tick spray. It's $8.98 for a large can of it at Wal-Mart. It kills the adults on contact, and does control the eggs and larvae fairly well. It's natural and safe to use around pets, and is said to be able to be sprayed right on them. Well, I use coconut oil on my cats now, instead, but I spray Simple Solutions around my carpet and linoleum about once a day (had a recent flea infestation, so now it's down to the stragglers) and it does great! Here's a link to it here on Amazon:
customer_reviews.author: JustRosy

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff, but prepare properly.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff killed EVERY FLEA AND EGG my parents had been trying to kill off for almost a year. It's great! But the powder, being powder, is a hazard to breathe in, so be sure you wear proper protection so you don't get sick!
customer_reviews.author: Brit

customer_reviews.title: Used for Mites
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly & well packaged. I used this on my white carpet and purple carpet for mites that came in on aspen pet bedding that I forgot to freeze before using. My living room is pretty large, it covered that plus my bedroom, & kitchen rug. I used this about a month ago & I believe it helped rid of the mites.
customer_reviews.author: Bree V.

customer_reviews.title: Bad for dogs.
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be safe to put on my carpets but after reading the instructions I found out that it is not. A person has to take the dog out a certain amount of time and then bring the dog back in. It is not possible for me to do this. I will use this outdoors in my yard and hopefully it will kill flees there.
customer_reviews.author: J. C. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: RESTORED MY BABIES BACK TO BEAUTIFUL & GLOSSY.
customer_reviews.text: WAS SO EASY TO USE. DID SPRAYING ON MY DECK & DOES NOT COME OUT TO THICK, I HAD NO RUNNING OR BUBBLES. I APPIED ABOUT 4 LIGHT COATS TO EACH. DRIES WITHIN 15 MINUTES FOR NEXT COAT. JUST KEEP APPLYING COATS UNTILL YOU AR SATISFIED WITH LOOK. VERY SATISFIED. I HAVE HAD THESE GIRAFFES FOR OVER 10 YEARS & THEY WERE LOOKING A BIT DINGY & TIRED. NO MORE!!! THANKS.
customer_reviews.author: Cobi L Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Flealess
customer_reviews.text: Left this on my carpets for a week while I went on vacation. I had a terrible flea infestation. Came back, vacuumed it, aint had a flea since. And its a green product I think. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Cowan

customer_reviews.title: Kills pests
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple of indoor dogs and their fleas were becoming a big issue. I removed them from the house for a day and sprinkled this stuff all over the carpet. I also treated the dogs. No more fleas! Also, I discovered a handful of carpet beetles dying in the kitchen and entry area (linoleum -- looks like they were trying to crawl to safety). Apparently it kills them too!
customer_reviews.author: Lars SveenTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: effective but strong
customer_reviews.text: Effective- Yes Convenient- Mildly , If you want this to last three or six months it has to stay on your carpet for 24hours. If you have kids or pets this is a big no no because you are not suppose to touch or eat the powder. It also is VERY strong smelling and that smell is very overwhelming however I cant deny that it did work even following the one hour directions. Open every window in your house when using this product.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony A

customer_reviews.title: Be careful if you have asthma
customer_reviews.text: It stunk, my asthma didn't like it to well because the smell was so strong. Also I didn't like to keep my cats locked up over night, it was hard on them. But apparently it worked. I only found a couple of fleas on one of my cats so I basically did this just in case there were more on the carpet. I haven't seen a flea since.
customer_reviews.author: catlover

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised and gets rid of the fleas !
customer_reviews.text: The shipping was fast as always and the price was great. I followed the instructions exactly and had excellent results. Within a few days all signs of fleas were gone. The smell is a little strong as others have stated, but it is at least a pleasant citrus scent so it is well tolerated. The dust settles quickly and cleans up easily. I would definitely recommend this type of treatment over chemical sprays as it is a lot less hazardous to your health.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip M Kuhn

customer_reviews.title: Worked very well for us
customer_reviews.text: We used this after buying a home infested by fleas from the previous owners. This was the second product we tried, the first a carpet spray, did not work well. This BioSpot Active Care Carpet Powder did the trick. We left it in for two days while out of town and vacuumed when we arrived home. Haven't seen a flea since (3 weeks). Wear a mask when applying because it gets real dusty. We had to wash our counter tops and exposed surfaces afterward, the dust gets everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Enscribe

customer_reviews.title: This product did not last as long as thought. ...
customer_reviews.text: This product did not last as long as thought. It worked, but for a very short amount of time. I might not have gotten every room or I may have underestimated how fast they reproduce, but it only made them stronger. They came back more organized and somehow can sense when I'm looking at them. Note to self don't let your roomate's gf move in because she'll get depressed and next thing you know you have 7 cats, a messy house and fleas.
customer_reviews.author: Jerrelle'

customer_reviews.title: Worked for us.
customer_reviews.text: We have multiple dogs. We've used this product twice over the years, and it's worked every time. I'm not super convinced it's less toxic than other carpet powders we've had, since it's like an absolute fumigation in a small space. But it gets the job done, and doesn't have the bad reputation of other brands. And that's enough for us.
customer_reviews.author: Kay H.

customer_reviews.title: and topical) and I am pleased to say that my flea issue is no longer ...
customer_reviews.text: After lots of research I decided to try the Bio Spot brand for my flea issue, thanks to spring time in TN and a cat and dog. I treated with Bio Spot trifecta (spray for inside, outside, and topical) and I am pleased to say that my flea issue is no longer a issue! The dead fleas around the house weren't so pleasant, but that simply means the products work!
customer_reviews.author: TN_Mom2011

customer_reviews.title: and maybe take them for a nice stroll or a car ride
customer_reviews.text: This powder worked fantastically. Fleas were a total surprise for us and I needed something quick and this did the job. The only thing I want to mention is, make sure you place your pets away from this stuff, and maybe take them for a nice stroll or a car ride, because it's incredibly fragrant and not in the best of ways. It made my lungs hurt a bit, being in the area with it (I had to work, so no choice at the time to leave) but it is a fantastic product.
customer_reviews.author: Darbii

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I wish the container was a bit larger so that it would cover more than one carpeted room, however it did seem to help. I used a broom to get the powder down into the carpet as recommended. By doing so, it did leave everything in our bedroom covered in a coat of white powder, but was easy to clean up, so that was not an issue. I let it sit for a couple of hours before vacuuming. Sure enough...there were lots of dead fleas in the vacuum container. YUCK!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Smith

customer_reviews.title: Probably not the fragrance I would have picked, but effective in stopping my flea problem!
customer_reviews.text: So I had to do a couple of applications to get rid of all the fleas in our house, there's a brand that's basically this exact same thing if you compare the labels at a large pet chain. I think partially the mechanical action of vacuuming, and partially the ability of this stuff to take care of the fleas biologically eliminated my issue. If I have any advice, you *must* do the tedious work of moving all your furniture and getting every corner of the house, and you *must* make sure that the food source (your lovely pets) are neutralized with a flea medication. Also, it doesn't smell too bad!
customer_reviews.author: Jason R Loss

customer_reviews.title: NOT PET FRIENDLY
customer_reviews.text: THIS PRODUCT IS NOT PET FRIENDLY. I have two puppies and almost used this product. You should state directly that this product should not be in contact with pets. Carpets are DEFINITELY places pets will be around.
customer_reviews.author: Shyh R Hwang

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend it to anyone
customer_reviews.text: After bombing my home 2 times and still finding these little buggers jumping around. There wasnt a lot of them to be considered and infestation but enough to get on your nerves. After using this product I have yet to see a single one. Its has now been 6 days and still no sign of them. This product is a God sent. Would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Worked well
customer_reviews.text: Took care of a mild case of fleas in the house from cat going in and out. Nothing else worked. Would definitely repurchase if needed.
customer_reviews.author: zimm42000

customer_reviews.title: Could be better.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work as well as I had hoped it would. Cancelled my subscription. It does smell good though.
customer_reviews.author: Crafty Sister 2

customer_reviews.title: Smells nice& vacuums up well
customer_reviews.text: Only used once or twice but seems to help, along with their flea/tick collars
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dead Fleas
customer_reviews.text: Wow this stuff really did work great! I had a really bad infestation that the spray stuff didn't fix. Beware that when you use a broom to brush it into the carpet, it WILL turn into a very fine powder and get everywhere! Wear a mask.
customer_reviews.author: Weasel

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: It's a good carpet powder, but not a great carpet powder. Not only do you have to use it more than once a week but it's tough to get out of the carpet.You have to get down on your knees with an extension of your vacuum cleaner and use a lot of "elbow grease" scraping it up and out of the rug.
customer_reviews.author: just Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Does not seem safe!
customer_reviews.text: I thelrew this product away. Seems too dangerous to use. If it touches your skin you have to wash your hands for 15 minutes. I would not apply this to my carpet and vacuum it up. There is no way the vacuum will suck it all up, leaving me to believe you will have irritated skin if you ever go barefoot or lay on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Allison vita

customer_reviews.title: I did not like the smell
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if it worked, but I think it did.. I used it on my couch and carpets. Followed directions. Let it sit for about 4 hours. I did not like the smell, but afterwards it was covered up by an air freshener. Two weeks later and my poor dog has fleas again. It helped but not sure if it completely solved the issue.
customer_reviews.author: D.Stel

customer_reviews.title: TOXIC
customer_reviews.text: I FOLLOWED DIRECTIONS 100% AND MY TWO PRECIOUS KITTIES ARE DEAD. !!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: nan ekelund

customer_reviews.title: We tried several things to try and get rid of ...
customer_reviews.text: We tried several things to try and get rid of fleas. Idk if it was one of the many pesticides we were trying but as soon as we tried this the fleas are gone. And haven't had any since putting this down.
customer_reviews.author: PigFat

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: Overal this just helped a little. My sisters dog got horrible fleas and I didn't want to use bombs to get them out of the house once the dog was treated. I used this on a Saturday and left it on for 1.5hrs then vacuumed thoroughly. It's now Monday and while it definitely cut down on them they are still there, so we are moving on to the next product.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: BEST flea powder for carpets
customer_reviews.text: Great product! The powder doesn't have an overpowering smell and works like magic! A few repetitive treatments and the fleas are gone!
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy Callahan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This is the best product i have found so far. Every other brand required me to go over the carpet once a month this one hasnt needed one yet its been a couple months
customer_reviews.author: SKITTLISM

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work As well as hoped
customer_reviews.text: I dont think it worked very well. Still have fleas, it did not cover 2 full rooms. My bedroom and living room aren't very large I feel it should have covered both, it didn't. The odor was very strong, if you are sensitive to scents I suggest having someone else do it for you. I will say I did watch it kill fleas that were on my couch but did not finish the whole job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: It did the trick percer no more ticks! Ps a 4 for the scent because it is something to kill off the bugs not make your home smell amazing just make sur you vent it and wear a mask when you put it down.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Creed

customer_reviews.title: Kills all bugs!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works! I put it around the perimeter of the rooms away from pets and kids , then I worked it into the carpet with an old paint brush and left it there. I did not vacuum it up. I also put it in between my mattress and box springs and under the sofa cushions. It killed everything!
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Works well, easy to apply, not too dusty
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the "shake into carpets, let sit, vacuum up" type of flea treatments. It worked just as described, we've had no recurrance of creepers. The smell is pleasant enough and dissipated quickly. As far as the relatively non-toxic options go this is the best I've found.
customer_reviews.author: Sierra

customer_reviews.title: Finally!
customer_reviews.text: This actually works!!! I left it swept into the carpet for the recommended 24 hours before vacuuming and and continued to vaccum once a day, all of the fleas were gone within a couple of days! Such a relief, seriously, I highly recommend this product and make sure to vaccum frequently!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Powder helps and also the smell 👌👌...has my whole apartment smelling so fresh
customer_reviews.author: Ariel N Wright

customer_reviews.title: Smell is strong and does not work
customer_reviews.text: Stinks, does not work and cakes making it difficult to get off anything it touches (I have moisture in one of the bedrooms and it made a HUGE mess)
customer_reviews.author: Missy

customer_reviews.title: WORKS WELL !
customer_reviews.text: kills bugs effectively and has a nice fragrance as well - supposed to keep on killing over few mos so great!
customer_reviews.author: Starlette

customer_reviews.title: Best thing is give your dog a capstar and then ...
customer_reviews.text: not really sure if it worked at all. Best thing is give your dog a capstar and then comfortis.
customer_reviews.author: BBQ_POPE

customer_reviews.title: Good product, worked as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great, smells terrible. Can't complain, I did my research and if this is an option you need to go to (which we did) this is definitely a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: HPrice

customer_reviews.title: Be careful, but it works
customer_reviews.text: Killed a lot of them, where I didn't put this I put a flea trap to test if it worked on the areas of the carpet I treated and caught a lot of fleas with the trap. None when it was on the treated carpet though.
customer_reviews.author: Fig Newton

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: We had a couple bouts of fleas in this hot, dry late summer. I spinkle this on my carpets in the morning and then sweep it. When I come home from work I vacuum it up. It works on my expensive rugs too. I haven't had the fleas come back since. I really only used this and then bathed our dog/ sprayed his bedding with another fleas spray. This product kills fleas and larvae. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: trayler

customer_reviews.title: STAINS YELLOW
customer_reviews.text: This powder is a yellow color and stained my beautiful white rug- horrible! Do not buy this product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: bio-spot products are the best. From sprays to collars to dust
customer_reviews.text: bio-spot products are the best. From sprays to collars to dust. This product has a clean refreshing scent and the powder seems more granular then most. I have used the bio-spot spray (for dogs) on my horses to kill ticks and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Shamrock

customer_reviews.title: This product works very well. I have had sucess ...
customer_reviews.text: This product works very well. I have had sucess at getting rid of all the fleas with this and the yard spray. Works well in conjunction with bathing and dipping pets to eradicate all the fleas.
customer_reviews.author: E. Chase

customer_reviews.title: Works wonders
customer_reviews.text: This was awesome. I purchased as used after we got our dog from the rescue. It got rid of fleas immediately. Will purchase again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: MsTisha325

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Super hard to get it out of the tube, extremely strong odor and did not take care of problem.
customer_reviews.author: Tiff

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product, although the fragrance is very strong. Set off my asthma and made me sneeze. But worth it! No signs of fleas, I left the powder on my carpet for 24hrs before vacuuming and did the job. Highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Worked great.
customer_reviews.text: This worked when nothing else would. Tried several other sprays and a bomb. They didn't work. This one did on the first go round and much cheaper than calling an exterminator. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Shop Texas

customer_reviews.title: Like everything else
customer_reviews.text: This didn't stink when I put it down. My carpet was cleaner and I noticed a decrease in the fleas. Like everything else, it works best if you use it more than once.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Henson

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: This product does not work. I've applied it twice to the same area and it made no difference. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Trips

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is ultra powerful. It killed all the ...
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is ultra powerful. It killed all the fleas in my bedroom, and guest bedroom, in just a day, and I still had some left over
customer_reviews.author: AlucardMG36

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Smells horrible. Beware. But seems to do the trick if you follow directions.
customer_reviews.author: LM271891

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works. Has a verrrrry powerful citrus odor ...
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works. Has a verrrrry powerful citrus odor, so only apply it when you can have all your windows open for the day!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Make the package a lot more secure ...not happy
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed on my package on arrival !! Almost half of all the powdered was spilled and leaking all over the counter and floor !!
customer_reviews.author: monica

customer_reviews.title: Smells great!
customer_reviews.text: So far easy to do and easy to clean up. It smells wonderful no dust and very easy to apply I suggest wearing plastic covers on your feet.
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle

customer_reviews.title: Noxious stuff. Wear protection over eyes nose and mouth ...
customer_reviews.text: Noxious stuff. Wear protection over eyes nose and mouth. Work quickly & leave the room, shutting the door behind you. A few hours later vaccum the carpet.
customer_reviews.author: Shopaholic

customer_reviews.title: It works well
customer_reviews.text: I tried the Raid flea spray for carpets, it reduced the frequency of bites but it didn't finish them off. I tried this product after trying the Raid spray and I haven't had a single bite in over six weeks. When using this product, I dispersed the powder as evenly and as close to the floor as possible. I let it sit for longer than the requisite time, four hours. I vacuumed when I got home and let the room air out because the vacuuming kicks up the powder. I suggest vacuuming several times after you apply, especially if the pile on your carpet is thick.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Product came partially opened, and had leaked chemicals all over the box, and then my clothes as I opened it! Did not seem to kill fleas.
customer_reviews.author: DHM

customer_reviews.title: Works well and smells good
customer_reviews.text: We used this product in hard-to-reach places in our basement. The fleas are gone, and we still have lots of product left because we used it sparingly. It has a fairly pleasant, clean smell, and looks/feels much like regular carpet powder. It contains Pyrethrins, which are 'natural' compounds that act as both an insecticide and insect repellent, so it will get rid of much more than just fleas. Perfect for the basement! It's still a toxic (mildly) chemical though, so keep kids and pets away, especially cats. Added bonus - when you vacuum this up, any stray fleas/eggs in your vacuum bag should also be killed, so no more putting vacuum bags in the freezer or throwing out half-empty ones.
customer_reviews.author: C B

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS GREAT ONLY IF YOU USE MY INSTRUCTIONS!!!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works great. The key is to use it VERY generously and brush it in with a broom. It'll completely fill up the room with dust from the product. Open a window and get a draft going through. DO NOT VACUUM IT UP!!! Leave it for days (it says up to 24 hours). People who are complaining are only leaving it in for a few hours. I promise you if you leave it in the carpet for a few days it'll kill the fleas. It smells citrusy so it's also kind of a room freshener. Give your animal a flea bath and high-quality flea meds. Don't go for the cheap stuff, especially if they've infested your carpet too.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle S

customer_reviews.title: This really did the trick.
customer_reviews.text: We had an issue with fleas last summer when the dog came in. They got all in the carpets and were biting us constantly. This was to the point of having socks on at all times (or stockings) and constantly checking our legs and keeping our feet off the floor to keep from being bitten. I want to say one can went around 2 (large) rooms. I might have put it on a bit heavy in one room, but they were bad down there! This stuff really did work, and boy was I glad for the relief and no more having to vacuum 4Xs a day and running the canister down to the burn pit.
customer_reviews.author: JEM

customer_reviews.title: BioSpot Active Care Carpet Powder
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for daughter and boyfriend. They used as directed and seems to have worked wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: The formula was so strong you should wear a mask while cleaning with it but it is definitely effective.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Beaudoin

customer_reviews.title: Break the Flea Cycle
customer_reviews.text: This product has been working great in breaking the cycle of my dog bringing home fleas every time we went for a walk in the country (that's where we live). I also use the Serestro collar as the companion technology.... no more fleas for my skin-sensitive schnauzer! yeah!
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Esteves

customer_reviews.title: Skip it.  Only works for a day or so till next round of eggs hatches.
customer_reviews.text: Only seemed to help for a day or so. Pleasant smell. Ended up ordering a 10 lb bag of diatomaceous earth and FLEA problem irradiated!!!! Perfectly safe even to ingest (just do not inhale as it can cause silicosis.) Also applied directly to my dogs coat after one dog had a horrible skin burn from a topical chemical flea treatment. I will never treat my home or animals with that poison again. Serious, look up the diatomaceous earth. Even cleared a roach issue that my grandmother had!!!! Cheap, chemical free and works!!!
customer_reviews.author: c1nicole

customer_reviews.title: Unsure
customer_reviews.text: Not great enough to buy again. Not quite sure if it worked so I can't give this more or less than 3 stars. Strong smelling product. Not unbearable, but strong. Fleas showed up a week after using. Not sure if due to new infestation or if product didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: LoveMills

customer_reviews.title: Thank you
customer_reviews.text: No more fleas after two treatments. First time I left it down for 24-48 hrs. Second time I left it down for 7 days. Now they're all gone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seemed to work
customer_reviews.text: This seemed to due the trick w/ my flea problem and my 2 cats. I would use again if I noticed the same bumps around my cats necks.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan M

customer_reviews.title: Fast Acting
customer_reviews.text: I had been watching a friends two cats and they began to scratch themselves. I placed them in a infested room for one hour and a half and then proceeded to sprinkle the powder in the flea infested area of the carpet. After this time I vacuumed the carpet thoroughly and let the cats out to move about the house. The cats did receive treatment to kill the ones they had on themselves. No more scratching. ( The treatment was Little City Dogs CHICKEN FLAVORED Flea Killer Capsules for Cats. )
customer_reviews.author: Requiem3k

customer_reviews.title: Pesky fleas
customer_reviews.text: Fleas are bad this year. The powder seemed to help get rid of them.
customer_reviews.author: Stoltzie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This powder works very well and unlike many of its competitors has a light and almost pleasant smell.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Good price
customer_reviews.text: Great price, I saw it at the pet store for almost twice the price. Product smells good as well and is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: mcarey1102

customer_reviews.title: Best flea killer ever!!
customer_reviews.text: Worked AMAZINGLY!! Easy as can be to use!! Will use again if the need arises.
customer_reviews.author: DZEMomma

customer_reviews.title: Waste of my time and money
customer_reviews.text: Used 3 applications to no effect; seemed to make the situation worse
customer_reviews.author: Shawnus

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Works really well and fast. Have only used if once so far. Left it on for only 3 hours and so far no more fleas
customer_reviews.author: Ingrid S

customer_reviews.title: it works
customer_reviews.text: Would use again. Will order more A friend told me about it and she order it to. Recommend to others
customer_reviews.author: sheila

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Kill all my flea in days!! It's a must have if you'd infested!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tony Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Works very well...awesome
customer_reviews.text: Shipment was ontime. will buy again and will recommend to friends and family...I will purchase this about every 6 months to make sure the fleas don't come back. :)
customer_reviews.author: mama3

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: used as directed. Fleas seem to eat it up. Waste of money. Maybe Florida flea are stronger than most, will try to find another product
customer_reviews.author: DAVID T KERRY

customer_reviews.title: GOOD NEWS EVERYONE!
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm and have had no other issues, if so I've got 3/4 more of a bottle to dump down :)
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be working, but there's some fleas here and there that just don't seem to die.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Campos

customer_reviews.title: Strong smell but worth it
customer_reviews.text: It produces a very strong smell - not necessarily bad, just strong. I've noticed a dramatic reduction in fleas on our cats and jumping onto us as a result.
customer_reviews.author: JDN

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This carpet powder really helped flea problem... Will be ordering on a regular basis to keep the fleas away!!
customer_reviews.author: peppermintny

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: this product worked great - and was very nice smelling - much better than having to bomb the place and safer for the kids and pet
customer_reviews.author: Pam Pendleton

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says!
customer_reviews.text: Had fleas really bad in carpet, (when you put hand on carpet you'd get at least 6 of them to jump on you at a time) bought this and the next morning after i sprinkled it there wasn't a single flea!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: it's like the fleas got mad and it felt like more ...
customer_reviews.text: I did what the direction said, it's like the fleas got mad and it felt like more of them. It didn't work
customer_reviews.author: Roy Walker

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but better cheaper products are out there. Use Diatomaceous earth.
customer_reviews.text: Smells ok but can be overwhelming. Use it before you leave for the day, or a weekend. After used I still had Feas.It was kind of a painful process to use this powder. I would highly suggest using something like food grade "Diatomaceous earth", it causes micro cuts in the exoskeleton of insects (fleas, roaches etc) and causes them to dehydrate. Diatomaceous earth is what I used to finally ride my house of fleas. Either treatments take several treatments and ~60 days to kill fleas and eggs, but Diatomaceous earth didn't give me breathing problems. Skill an OK product, glad I tried it.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Those five star ratings are misleading.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product based upon good reviews. Know what? This product is akin to snake oil. Not only did it do absolutely nothing against the fleas in my place, it made things worse on my animals. Dont buy it. Save your money for a vaccum and boric acid.
customer_reviews.author: A random guy

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Product worked great! Will use on all of my rental properties.
customer_reviews.author: Rita Hacker

customer_reviews.title: Product did the trick, where other types failed.
customer_reviews.text: Killed the fleas with minimal smell. Used this in conjunction with a deep cleaning vacuum. The combo worked where NOTHING else had. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: B. M. Sundeen

customer_reviews.title: Strong odor
customer_reviews.text: I have not yet been able to use the product yet. I could smell the odor of it directly after opening the box it came in. So it has a strong odor. But Im hoping that means it works. But I will update this when I have the chance to try it. that is if im able to update the review.
customer_reviews.author: priscilla

customer_reviews.title: ... thought it was all natural but that is my bad for not reading
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was all natural but that is my bad for not reading. If you are sensitive wear a mask when spreading it. I didn't read anything first and spread it all over and had a mild reaction. Nothing serious.
customer_reviews.author: MamaJ

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: did 2 applications in 2 rooms, used plenty at each application.... fleas were not gone - switched to a flea spray called Siphotrol - BAM!
customer_reviews.author: believeinthestars

customer_reviews.title: Don't waist your money this product is a scam. ...
customer_reviews.text: Don't waist your money this product is a scam. I followed the directions to the tea, I also treated my cats with another product at the same time. It did absolutely nothing but took my money. If you just have to buy it anyways make sure you have something to cover your eyes nose and mouth because when you use the broom to work it into the carpet, your going clouds of this stuff flying in the air.
customer_reviews.author: Rock2udrop

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous !! don't buy it !
customer_reviews.text: chemical-based, full of warnings after i used this item my lung have been hurt still now..
customer_reviews.author: ljclapper

customer_reviews.title: Cost effective and effective for in home treatments
customer_reviews.text: Used this for my carpets after my dog got a bad infestation of fleas. I applied like directed and vacuumed all over, haven't seen any fleas since!
customer_reviews.author: kristen

product_meta.title: Bio Spot Active Care Flea & Tick Carpet & Upholstery Powder
product_meta.description: Size:SmallBio Spot Active Care™ Carpet Powder is designed to kill fleas and ticks that live on carpets and to prevent re-infestation for up to a year
feature_bullets: Kills all 4 stages of the flea: eggs, larvae, pupae and adults
